newsitem.title: USA: Quote.com names former Thomson executive as CEO.
newsitem.headline: Quote.com names former Thomson executive as CEO.

text.p: Quote.com Inc., which provides aggregated financial market information to investors over the Internet, on Monday named Thomas Henry to the positions of president and chief executive officer.
Henry has two decades of experience in the information technology area, including management in the financial sector of the business for the last 10 years, the company said.

Most recently, Henry was senior director of the corporate product development and management for Information Access Company, a subsidiary of Thomson Corp, managing product planning for the $80 million operating unit.

Quote.com founder Chris Cooper said Henry would assume daily executive and operational responsibility at the company, and Cooper will continue to participate in daily operations, including development oftechnical applications and tools.

Prior to Information Access, Henry was co-founder and application design leader for Sandpoint Co., a supplier of corporate information services, and served as vice president for product creation and marketing. He successfully launched the information agent product Hoover for Lotus Notes, Quote.com said.
Sandpoint was bought by Ziff Communications in 1995.

Quote.com said there is no change to the organizational structure at the company, whose board now includes Henry, Cooper, Sequoia Capital Corp's Michael Moritz and Robert Honeycutt, chief operating officer of Barra Corp.

Founded in 1993, Quote.com began providing service over the World Wide Web in mid-1994 and now hass 170,000 registered users, including a high portion of active investors with significant net worth, according to the company.
The Quote.com Web site (http://quote.com) has reported traffic highs of 1.2 million visits per day, with more than 20 million page views a month," the company said.
Quote.com has a content network of 65 co-branded Web sites with partners including Charles Schwab, E*TRADE, Prudential Securities, Infoseek, Netscape Communications Corp and Excite Inc.
